question: All right, Ross, we will go to our first question and actually an interesting theory from Evan. He says, "Thank you, Ross and Megan, for all your hard work. Watch you guys all the time." I know they are all around the world, but it's interesting that they are spotted in localized areas like New Jersey. It's not like we see them out over here in Lexington, North Carolina. I'm surprised no one has thought of this as a possibility. U I I have to say if they are looking for their own tech, then there's a hell of a lot of tech that they've had taken off them that's hanging around the continent of the United States. And just to respond to your uh point about North Carolina, there have been sightings in and around North Carolina, repeated sightings. I've spoken to people who've been seeing these purported drones, but even more interestingly, large black triangle objects. Um, the uh gentleman we interviewed a few weeks ago, Magic Mike Batista, he lives very near Fort Bragg in South Carolina. and uh he told me about an incident that uh was attended by among other people Fred Baker, the u uh special forces soldier now retired, who was with him when they summoned allegedly a gigantic multiple football fieldsiz triangular craft. It's interesting because I actually favor the explanation more likely that what we're talking about here is if it is non-human intelligence, and I suspect some of it is, I suspect they're taking an interest in weapons, defense facilities, nuclear armed, nuclearpowered facilities. and I hope they're friendly. There's a great quote from a uh an Australian journalist who was investigating UAPs in New Zealand, Quinton Fogerty, and he said, "Let's hope they're friendly because whatever they are, they're demonstrating um what you might call ISR, intelligence, surveillance, and reconnaissance. Every single nuclear site in the United States has probably been visited by NHI, UAPs." Robert Hastings wonderful book, UFOs and Nukes, tells the story really well. Robert set out to investigate sightings that he heard about when he was sweeping the floors at a US Air Force base and he discovered over many decades that there were people who'd seen objects over nuclear weapons facilities, nuclear uh power facilities in pretty much every such facility in the United States. And this is the same all around the world. So, I favor the idea that whatever they are, they're taking an interest in in nuclear weapons because perhaps they're concerned about our use of nuclear weapons. Or worse still, perhaps they're wrecking to find out where our most powerful weapons are. I just don't know the answer. But it's completely within the realms of plausibility in my book that if you're a non-human intelligence coming back to this planet, you're interested to know where your technology is being stored by the United States. And certainly there are a lot of sightings over Tonipar, Area 51, uh China Lake, all of those big national security ranges that none of us are allowed into. And I'd love to have a look inside the dark caves and crevices inside those facilities because I'm told there are some very interesting things locked away. I'd also be taking a very close interest in Sedona, uh, which is the place where we've told the story previously of an alleged deep underground military base.
All right, we will go to an email. This is coming in from Renee. Dear Megan Ross,
answer: forgive me for interrupting, Megan. I should say  I should say Melinda Leslie recently told me she's the Sedona based UAP tour guide uh who takes people out on night vision goggle tour guides and Belinda let me know just this week that the frequency of UAPs being observed over Secret Mountain at Sedona being escorted by military helicopters it's completely off the charts. She's saying she's never seen such an intensity before. So whatever these objects are, it's happening much much more frequently.

question: All right. Well, this email that I'm just about to read, this is some objects being seen as well. So, dear Megan and Ross, I live in the city named Ron located at Borholm Island. And nobody can explain what this is. And the interesting thing is the language that's been used of to describe the objects that were over the airport is drones. And this correspondent immediately delineates between what they're seeing and the reported drones over the airport. And frankly, I'm not buying that they're different. I still think we need to consider the possibility that they're all one and the same objects, but that they're capable of changing form. At the moment, uh we're talking I think it's uh early October. There is no evidence at this stage even though there's been a police raid on a um a ship called the Borke or Bourke. I've forgotten what it is, but it's a a tanker that was boarded by French naval forces with great publicity and apparently the captain and the first mate were arrested. There's no evidence anywhere on that ship of drone technology. Now admittedly, if it was the dastardly Ruskies, they would have thrown it overboard, I'm sure. Why are we not able to track these objects and follow them to source? And when they're hovering over empty areas, as we know they have been, why are they not able to be brought down with high pulse microwave or other counter UAS technology? I'm not saying it's not the Ruskies. I'm just saying show me the evidence. And isn't it clever the way that the word drones is used to immediately plant in the mind of the public the most plausible Okam's razor explanation that this is just the Russians. And I think there's a risk behind that. The risk is escalation. The risk is that the Russians get upset that they're being accused incorrectly perhaps of deploying these drones. And frankly, we should ask, we should test these claims that are being made. There is no evidence at this stage that it's the Russians. Um I do recall uh a drone flap, I think it was back 2022, 2023 over Sweden and there was an arrest made of a young Russian man and a lot was made in the national media at the time that he was linked to Putin through his father because his father ran the railways in Russia and he was arrested and accused of spying using a drone. And it turned out he was acquitted. Not really widely reported. He was acquitted because it wasn't able to be proven that he knew that what he was doing was illegal. He had a yacht. He put his drone up over his yacht and he was arrested for using his drone. So, a lot of the evidence that's being used to point at the Russians, yes, I know the Russians are quite capable of being duplicitous and dastardly and evil and they will do terrible things if they can get away with it. But in this case, I just want to see evidence. Show me the evidence and why can't we track or bring down these objects? It doesn't make any sense to me.  Okay, Russ, we were going to stick with um questions about the egg. And what really I think frustrates me is Congress could do this. Congress knows all this because they've been told about all of this in secure skiff hearings by Jake Barber. Um, I think it's an extraordinary act of courage by Jake Barber to have come out and said what he said and done what he's done. answer: Look, it's very sad. We we were devastated to hear this. question: Okay. We will go to a question from Chris on X. Hi Megan, how are you hun? I am good. Can you ask Ross what his thoughts are on NASA cutting the live feed from Mars when three Atlas went past? Everything was going well. Then they turned into a gray screen. What are they hiding?
answer: You know, it's funny. I never believed any of the NASA conspiracy theories until very very recently. I always thought it was nonsense that NASA cut the feed. And I now realize someone is cutting the feed because I've seen it. I've actually seen it happen. Um I can't comment one way or the other about the three eye atlas feed being cut because frankly I just don't know if it was. I I I assume that there was a disruption. And look, disruptions do happen to transmissions. Obviously, it's a big thing to be able to receive or send a a transmission across space. So, it wouldn't surprise me at all if occasionally there are disruptions. But I'll tell you my story, which I have told before, but I was um invited uh to tour as a VIP the Marshall Space Center when I was giving a speech at the Huntsville Scientific Coalition for the Study of UAPs two years ago. And it was a great opportunity and I remain very grateful to the local director of NASA on location who very kindly ushered me around with the wife of another former NASA administrator Mike Griffin. And while we were on location in the viewing room where there's a huge bank of video feeds from the space station, the International Space Station, um we were looking at the feeds with the director of the Marshall Space Center talking to me uh with his back to those screens. And there's the control room for the receiving of signals and control of the space station to my right that we're looking at through this glass window. And as he's talking to me, Rebecca nudges me and goes, "Look." And there are maybe eight or nine eggshaped objects moving from behind the space station. And the camera is pointed out into interstellar space, and you see these egg-shaped objects just tracking along in formation very, very slowly. And I very naively ask the director of the Marshall Space Center, is, "Excuse me, sir. Is are they Starlink satellites? Has somebody just released Starlink satellites?" And he turns, looks at the feed, sees the objects, and then he looks through the window into the main control room and they flick a switch and they do it right in front of us. Transmission to the space station has been interrupted. Now, I I don't know what happened. I'm not suggesting any sinister motive on the part of the director of the Marshall Space Center, but I saw it happen and so did two other people, including the wife of a former NASA administrator. So, it happened. And the the thing that interested me was it almost seemed to be routine. And when I went back to try and look at feeds to see if I could find what I'd seen, it wasn't there. So, I've seen a disruption to the feed and it made me feel very very uncomfortable. What I was seeing was clearly anomalous to people in the room and uh I never got an explanation. The um the director went and he had to move on because he was committed on other tasks. But I never got an explanation for what that was, which remains profoundly interesting. As for the 3i Atlas uh video feed disruption, I didn't see it happen. I don't know anything about it, but I can tell you I've seen strange disruptions to the feeds, the video feeds through NASA.
